original_title: South Korean Ambassador Woonjin Jeong bids adieu to Sri Lanka
original_body_lines: The outgoing South Korean Ambassador to Sri Lanka Woonjin Jeong called on President Ranil Wickremesinghe at the Presidential Secretariat prior to his departure last week.
Woonjin Jeong who officially announced his end of term in Sri Lanka, engaged in a friendly discussion with the President.

President Wickremesinghe thanked the South Korean Ambassador for his service rendered to Sri Lanka during his tenure and wished him success in all his future undertakings. Woonjin Jeong assumed office as South Korean Ambassador to Sri Lanka in July 2020.
Senior Adviser to the President on Climate Change Ruwan Wijewardene was also present during this occasion.
